Can you explain how the encryption works and why the extra characters are not necessary?</s> 
Rot13 encryption is a simple letter substitution cipher that replaces each letter in the plaintext with the letter that comes 13 places after it in the alphabet. For example, A is replaced with N, B with O, and so on. To reverse the encryption (i.e. decrypt), you would reverse the substitution process. The reason extra characters are not necessary is because in order to encrypt and decrypt a message using Rot13, all you need is the ASCII code for each letter in the alphabet. Once you have those codes, you can use them to rotate the letters in the plaintext and obtain the ciphertext. The extra characters added by your program are not necessary for the encryption and decryption process.
